item.title: Panglao mayor says island is safe for swimming citing EMB findings - INQUIRER.net
item.description:
Panglao mayor says island is safe for swimming citing EMB findings  INQUIRER.net

Panglao Island is still safe for bathing, a local official said.

item.title: Bohol banks on new 'eco-airport' for tourism push - ABS-CBN News
item.description:
Bohol banks on new 'eco-airport' for tourism push  ABS-CBN News

Bohol eyes to double its tourist arrivals by 2020 with the opening of its new international airport, a local government official said Tuesday.

item.title: Bohol-Panglao International Airport: With a little help from Japan, PHL opens its first eco-airport - Business Mirror
item.description:
Bohol-Panglao International Airport: With a little help from Japan, PHL opens its first eco-airport  Business Mirror

Central Visayas may soon outshine the rest of the country's tourist destinations with the opening to commercial operations of the Bohol-Panglao International.

item.title: Resort in Panglao Island reopens after paying fine - ABS-CBN News
item.description:
Resort in Panglao Island reopens after paying fine  ABS-CBN News

PANGLAO ISLAND - The Bureau of Internal Revenue in Central Visayas ordered the temporary closure of Bohol Henann Resort in this island for failure to issue ...

item.title: Swimming ban slapped on 2 Panglao, El Nido sites - Business Mirror
item.description:
Swimming ban slapped on 2 Panglao, El Nido sites  Business Mirror

THE Inter-Agency Task Force on island destinations has ordered the local governments of El Nido and Panglao Island to implement a no-swimming policy in ...

item.title: Inauguration of P8.9-B Bohol-Panglao int’l airport set for Nov. 27 - INQUIRER.net
item.description:
Inauguration of P8.9-B Bohol-Panglao int’l airport set for Nov. 27  INQUIRER.net

The inauguration of the P8.9-billion Bohol-Panglao international airport is set for Tuesday, Nov. 27, the Department of Transportation (DOTr) announced on ...

item.title: Water quality at Panglao improving, tests show - INQUIRER.net
item.description:
Water quality at Panglao improving, tests show  INQUIRER.net

Latest tests done by the environment department on the waters of Panglao Island in Bohol province, showed that most areas frequented by tourists there were ...

item.title: No need to issue EO on Panglao, El Nido rehab - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
No need to issue EO on Panglao, El Nido rehab  SunStar Philippines

PRESIDENT Rodrigo Duterte will not issue an executive order on the rehabilitation of tourist spots Panglao Island in Bohol and El Nido in Palawan, Malacañang said on Wednesday, December 5. This was agreed upon during a Cabinet meeting presided over by Duterte at the Malacañan Palace on Tuesday, December 4, Presidential Spokesperson Salvador Panelo said. "On the rehabilitation of Panglao Island in Bohol and El Nido in Palawan, the Cabinet agreed that there is no need to issue an Executive Order," the Palace official said in a statement. On November 9, the Department of Tourism announced the ...

item.title: PAL transfers to new Panglao airport - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
PAL transfers to new Panglao airport  SunStar Philippines

ALL flights of Philippine Airlines (PAL) to and from Bohol will now arrive and depart from the new Bohol Panglao International Airport, located in Barangay Tawala, Municipality of Panglao, after the national carrier transferred there last November 28. The old Tagbilaran Airport, located in Tagbilaran City proper, was closed effective at 6 a.m. on November 28. This is in accordance with the urgent official notification issued by the Civil Aviation Authority of the Philippines (CAAP). The new Bohol Panglao International Airport will thus be the sole commercial airport serving the province of ...

item.title: Resort in Panglao Island reopens after paying fine - ABS CBN News
item.description:
ABS CBN News

PANGLAO ISLAND - The Bureau of Internal Revenue in Central Visayas ordered the temporary closure of Henann Resort in this island for failure to issue receipts and under declaration of gross receipts. The Bureau of Internal Revenue in Central Visayas ordered the closure of Henann Resort in Panglao, Bohol. ‎Annie Fe Perez‎, ABS-CBN News The regional office of the BIR conducted a surveillance of two months and issued a 48-hour notice for the establishment to comply with their requirements, which resort management failed to follow, said Director Ed Pagulayan. Henann Resort legal counsel Alex Si...

item.title: Tagbilaran Airport to be closed, all flights moving to Bohol-Panglao - Rappler
item.description:
Tagbilaran Airport to be closed, all flights moving to Bohol-Panglao  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – The Civil Aviation Authority of the Philippines (CAAP) announced on Tuesday, November 27, that the Tagbilaran Airport in Bohol will be closed starting 6 pm. All flights going to the province will be transferred to the new Bohol-Panglao International Airport in Panglao Island once it becomes operational on Wednesday, November 28, at 6 am. JUST IN: CAAP issues a notice to the public that Tagbilaran Airport is officially closed for operations starting 6 pm today, November 27. All operations will be transferred to the new Bohol-Panglao International Airport at 6 am on Wedn...

item.title: IN PHOTOS: Bohol-Panglao International Airport - Rappler
item.description:
IN PHOTOS: Bohol-Panglao International Airport  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – The Bohol-Panglao International Airport, dubbed the country's first "eco-friendly" airport, will start operations on Wednesday, November 28. President Rodrigo Duterte, along with transportation, tourism, and provincial officials, were set to inaugurate the new airport on Tuesday, November 27. 'Total upgrade' The Civil Aviation Authority of the Philippines said the new airport is a "total upgrade" from the nearby Tagbilaran Airport, which used to be the gateway to Bohol. The Tagbilaran Airport will now be closed. The new airport is built on a 220-hectare site in Panglao...

item.title: Espinoza: The Abus made a statement - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Espinoza: The Abus made a statement  Sun.Star Philippines

THERE is no truth to the rumor that bounty hunters are acting up after a civic-spirited person offered a P100,000 reward to anyone who can give information to the police or the military on the whereabouts of the Abu Sayyaf members who survived last week’s clash in Inabanga town. Eight Abus are still allegedly hiding in Bohol after the skirmish with the police and military in Barangay Napo, Inabanga that left nine people killed, including three of the terrorists. The bounty offer was also timed with the start yesterday of the Association of South Asian Nations (Asean) meetings in Panglao Isl...

item.title: Info on ASG trickle in after offer of reward - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Info on ASG trickle in after offer of reward  Sun.Star Philippines

POLICE Regional Office 7 Director Noli Taliño said they received several information about the eight suspected members of the Abu Sayyaf after a P100,000 bounty was put up for each of them. The official said they are verifying the tip-off. Before the reward money was put up by an anonymous individual, Taliño said they received information on the whereabouts of the Abu Sayyaf members. Intelligence units of the military and the police are tracking the location of the bandits, who escaped during their gunfight with government troops in Inabanga, Bohol last week. Taliño said the investigators a...

item.title: Bohol lawyer's killers identified - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Bohol lawyer's killers identified  Sun.Star Philippines

POLICE have identified the gunmen and the possible mastermind behind the killing of an environmental lawyer in Tagbilaran City, Bohol. Superintendent Nicomedes Olaivar Jr., the city police chief, said the victim, Mia Manuelita Mascariñas-Green, 49, was caught in the trouble between her client and the owner of a famous beach resort in Panglao Island. Green was shot and killed by four gunmen while she was onboard her vehicle on her way home at 4:27 p.m. of February 15. READ: Lawyer killed in Bohol ambush Police said the possible mastermind is the son-in-law of the victim's client. The client ...

item.title: Region 7 still on full alert: Taliño - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Region 7 still on full alert: Taliño  Sun.Star Philippines

POLICE Regional Office 7 Director Noli Taliño welcomed the P100,000 bounty for the eight remaining suspected members of the Abu Sayyaf terror group, saying it might encourage the public to give information to police and military. The alleged terrorists reportedly escaped during their clash with government forces in Barangay Napo, Inabanga, Bohol last April 11. Taliño said they are still on full alert and security tight in Bohol, Cebu and Siquijor. More than 5,000 military and police personnel, including tanods, will secure the start of Association of Southeast Asian Nations (Asean) meetings...

item.title: Betten extends winning streak to four in PHL races - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Betten extends winning streak to four in PHL races  Sun.Star Philippines

AUSSIE Sam Betten and Amelia Watkinson of New Zealand ruled the men’s and women’s pro divisions of the 2016 Bellevue Resort 5i50 Triathlon in Panglao Island, Bohol yesterday. Betten won for the second straight year in Bohol and clinched his fourth 5i50 distance title in the country. The 6-foot-4 Betten breasted the tape in 2 hours, 1 minute and 40 seconds, beating Henry Beck of Germany and Philippine-based Daniel Brown. Beck finished second in 2:10:07, while Brown came in at 2:29:37 for third place. Betten, 28, dominated the 1.5-kilometer swim, 40K bike and 10K run race as he led from the g...

item.title: Bohol lawyer's 'killer' now in CIDG-Central Visayas - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Bohol lawyer's 'killer' now in CIDG-Central Visayas  Sun.Star Philippines

THE Criminal Investigation and Detection Group (CIDG)-Central Visayas presented Monday, July 3, the alleged mastermind and killer of Bohol lawyer Mia Mascariñas-Green who was caught in Davao last June 30. The suspect, Lloyd Gonzaga, arrived at the CIDG-Central Visayas office Monday morning. He is facing charges for multiple murder and illegal possession of firearms and explosives. Gonzaga went into hiding for almost four months. He and three others reportedly ambushed Green, who was with her three children while onboard a vehicle on their way home at 4:27 p.m. of February 15 in Purok Dos, Z...

item.title: World-famous island in Bohol gets 24-hour electricity supply - Rappler
item.description:
World-famous island in Bohol gets 24-hour electricity supply  Rappler

BOHOL, Philippines – Balicasag, an island in Bohol province globally known for diving and snorkeling due to its rich marine life, is now fully energized. The National Power Corporation's Small Power Utilities Group (Napocor-SPUG) installed a diesel-fed generator set that can supply electricity to some 225 households around the clock. During a switch-on ceremony Monday, September 4, officials announced that a 24-hour power service will enhance economic activity and people's productivity. This ends decades of insufficient power supply that was available only from 6 pm to 11 pm in Balicasag Is...

item.title: ‘Surprise party’ - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
‘Surprise party’  Sun.Star Philippines

PANGLAO, Bohol—Cebu’s Jorry Ycong of Repro Optima was in the Meet the Champs for the first time of his career but he barely talked when questions were thrown at him. There was no need as Ycong did all the talking in the field and broke his personal best to walk away with the men’s Filipino elite title in the 2016 Bellevue Resort 5i50 Triathlon in Panglao yesterday. Ycong pulled off an upset after completing the 1.5-kilometer race, 40K bike and 10K run race in 2 hours, 10 minutes and 55 seconds, and stood tall in the stacked Filipino elite field. The 26-year-old running coach dethroned defen...

item.title: Indulge in the beauty of nature - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Indulge in the beauty of nature  Sun.Star Philippines

AS one opens his eyes, he sees the intricate zigzag of the wood panels inside the roof with the skylight trying its hardest to fill the room with light. Slowly, he opens up the blinds, and in comes a wonderful view of nature at its finest. Outside, the dewy grass feels wonderful on one’s feet as he inhales the fresh scent of the botanical garden that envelopes all around him. A beauteous sight; and for a moment, a guest feels like he’s out of this world in a paradise that can’t seem to be compared; a botanical garden paradise away from the chaos of the city. Tarsier Botanika is a beautiful ...

item.title: Carvajal: Garden to admire - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Carvajal: Garden to admire  Sun.Star Philippines

SOME people have told me that my columns are more negative than positive. If you are one of them, I owe you this explanation. My assignment to write a political opinion column is akin to that of a gardener’s which is not the positive act of admiring the garden but the negative chore of plant hygiene such as uprooting weeds, cutting out ugly dying branches and getting rid of harmful pests so his master, the owner, can admire the garden. But still I must say that a gardener does have to admire the garden occasionally or else what is the point of doing all that plant hygiene thing? That’s exac...

item.title: PRO 7 probes Tagbilaran, Panglao cops - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
PRO 7 probes Tagbilaran, Panglao cops  Sun.Star Philippines

THE Police Regional Office (PRO) 7 is investigating members of Panglao and Tagbilaran police stations, both in Bohol Province, for allegedly protecting the suspected killers of an environment lawyer. The investigation stemmed from the complaint filed by businesswoman Conrada Blomqvist before the Office of PRO 7 Director Noli Taliño yesterday for also allegedly ignoring her request for assistance when murder suspects Lloyd Gonzaga and Romarico Benigian took over the Alona Embrace Hotel, her property, and threatened lawyer Mia Mascariñas-Green. "When he fired all my guards and replaced them w...

item.title: Husband of lawyer slain in ambush files murder cases - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Husband of lawyer slain in ambush files murder cases  Sun.Star Philippines

“MOMMY is dead, Daddy. Mommy is dead. Come home, Daddy now!” That was the frantic phone call that British national Stuart James Green received from his 10-year-old daughter, who broke to him the news about the ambush on their mother, Manuelita “Mia” Mascariñas-Green, last Feb. 15. In his affidavit, which he attached to support the filing of murder and multiple attempted murder against four people, Green narrated how the lawyer used her body as a shield to protect her three children inside the vehicle during the ambush. Last Feb. 18, 2017, Green filed the complaint before the Office of the C...

item.title: Be Resort helps village in Panglao - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Be Resort helps village in Panglao  Sun.Star Philippines

A RESORT in Panglao, Bohol continues to support the Danao Elementary School in Barangay Danao with another donation to add more classrooms to accommodate the growing number of students. Pearl Lorraine Yang, officer-in-charge of Be Grand Resort-Panglao, handed over the donation to school principal Estrella Peliño in a ceremony held recently. In 2013, a magnitude 7.2 earthquake hit Central Visayas, where most damage occurred in Bohol. In August 2016, Be Resort collaborated with the Danao Elementary for the donation of building supplies, which paved the way for the construction of two classroo...

item.title: Japanese teacher boosts livelihood capacities of SPED graduates in Bohol - Rappler
item.description:
Japanese teacher boosts livelihood capacities of SPED graduates in Bohol  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Life in Panglao, an island off the southwestern tip of Bohol province, has relatively been simple. But this has not stopped young people there from dreaming of achieving life’s endless possibilities. Even persons with intellectual disabilities (PWIDs) are inspired to continue dreaming and go beyond stereotypes with the help of a Japanese-run home that caters to special education (SPED) learners. (READ: Path to inclusion: La Salle college guides PWD learners) Babita House is a two-storey dormitory located in the town of Dauis, a 4th income class municipality in Panglao...

item.title: Biggest gathering of cyclists takes off - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Biggest gathering of cyclists takes off  Sun.Star Philippines

CYCLISTS and triathletes will once again troop to Bohol for the three-day cycling event— MotorAce Kawasaki Giro D’ Luca— slated on May 26 to 28 at the Bellevue Hotels and Resorts in Panglao Island. The event, now on its fifth year, has attracted more than 400 participants for the challenging 500-kilometer ride around the scenic areas in Bohol. “Bohol is the nearest place to Cebu, and we’re in love with the place—the nature, the people and its view. Bohol is the place to be for long rides,” said Gianluca Guidicelli during the press conference at Ssangyong Cebu in Gorordo Ave. yesterday. Star...

item.title: 2016 Bellevue Triathlon to kick off in Bohol - Rappler
item.description:
2016 Bellevue Triathlon to kick off in Bohol  Rappler

BOHOL, Philippines – Some 650 athletes from 25 countries will vie for the Pros, Filipino Elite and Age Group titles in The Bellevue Resort 5i50 Triathlon, which will kick off early Sunday, November 6, in Panglao island in Bohol. Defending champion Sam Betten of Australia will view for another back-to-back title in the 5i50 series of races of Sunrise Events Incorporated after he also ruled the Regent 5i50 in Subic in June. The race will cover 1.5-kilometer swim, 40-kilometer bike, and 10-kilometer run. The 6-foot-4 Betten said he is very focused on clinching his fourth title in the event and...

item.title: Sunrise Sprint in Bellevue5150 Tri - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Sunrise Sprint in Bellevue5150 Tri  Sun.Star Philippines

A SHORT distance race series, featuring a 750m swim, a 20k bike and a 5k run, will spice up The Bellevue Resort 5i50 Triathlon this Sunday with a huge field expected to vie for top honors at the Bellevue Resort in Panglao Island, Bohol. Dubbed the Sunrise Sprint, the event is expected to lure beginners wanting to immerse themselves into triathlon racing, a tri warrior who has been off the circuit and out to make a comeback or simply a triathlon enthusiast. The organizing Sunrise Events, Inc. launched the event in Subic Bay early this year and inspired by the tremendous response, it has incl...

item.title: 500-kilometer Giro D' Luca kicks off in Bohol - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
500-kilometer Giro D' Luca kicks off in Bohol  Sun.Star Philippines

THE three-day Motor-Ace Kawasaki Giro D’ Luca in Bohol kicks off at the Bellevue Hotels and Resorts in Panglao Island tomorrow. The fun ride will cover a total of 500 kilometers and will start with a daunting 200-kilometer ride from the host resort going out to Guindulman, Bohol and back on Friday. The participants will cross a 140-kilometer course from the resort to Carmen Public Market and back to the resort on the second day. To make the ride more exciting, the organizers will not yet announce the course for the third and final day, which will cover 160 kilometers. The participants come ...

item.title: Australians look to defend titles in 5i50 - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Australians look to defend titles in 5i50  Sun.Star Philippines

SAM Betten and Dimity Lee Duke set out for the Bellevue Resort 5i50 Triathlon unfolding Nov. 6 at the Bellevue Resort in Panglao Island, Bohol, upbeat of their chances but wary of the elite field out to foil their back-to-back title bids. The Australian duo dominated the 1.5k swim, 40k bike and 10k run event last year but will be in for a tougher challenge this time with a crack set of rivals all primed up for a shot at 5i50 honors and the $2,000 top prize in both sides. They include fellow Aussies Alexander Polizzi and Michelle Duffield, Amelia Rose Watkinson of New Zealand and local based...

item.title: 10 Best Local Places to Spend 'Babe Time' With Your Boyfriend - Female Network
item.description:
10 Best Local Places to Spend 'Babe Time' With Your Boyfriend  Female Network

IMAGE (left) Instagram @rallyreal, (right) Instagram @nicofsbh Spending quality alone time with your partner away from work is one of the most essential things in a relationship. And when you two travel, you get to experience new things and even get to see each other in a different light. But while grand, foreign destinations and big cities are exciting, there's also a very romantic side to traveling the islands of the Philippines together. Here are some of the best local destinations where you and your beau can create more amazing milestones as a couple: 1. Coron, Palawan This tropical par...

item.title: Cop chiefs deny tales of coddling ‘killer’ - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Cop chiefs deny tales of coddling ‘killer’  Sun.Star Philippines

POLICE Regional Office 7 Director Noli Taliño said the police chiefs of Panglao and Tagbilaran City denied giving the alleged mastermind behind the death of environmental lawyer Mia Mascariñas-Green special treatment. Tagbilaran City Police Chief Nicomedes Olaivar denied knowing the suspect, Lloyd Gonzaga. For his part, Panglao Island Police Chief Joemar Pomarejos admitted knowing Gonzaga, but he denied giving protection to the manager of Alona Embrace Hotel. The investigation stemmed from the complaint filed by businesswoman Conrada Blomqvist before Taliño last Monday. Green was the counse...

item.title: Malacañang urged to help arrest suspects - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Malacañang urged to help arrest suspects  Sun.Star Philippines

A BOHOL-BASED trader urged President Rodrigo Duterte and PNP Chief Ronald “Bato” dela Rosa to help arrest the alleged gunmen and mastermind in the killing of an environmental lawyer in Tagbilaran City, Bohol last Feb. 15. Conrada Blomqvist, client of slain lawyer Mia Manuelita Mascariñas-Green, told reporters yesterday that they would pursue the case against Lloyd Lancer Gonzaga, the alleged mastermind, and Romarico Benegi-an, the suspected gunman. Blomqvist held a press conference in the office of her counsel, Inocencio dela Cerna, yesterday afternoon. Gonzaga, 34; and Benegi-an, 33, of Da...

item.title: Abejo subsidiary to begin Panglao water distribution - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Abejo subsidiary to begin Panglao water distribution  Sun.Star Philippines

A SUBSIDIARY of Abejo Waters Corp. will begin its commission of the first 24-hour daily water distribution in Panglao, Bohol next month. Panglao Water Services Inc. (PWSI) covers the entire municipality, with residents and business establishments of Panglao being its first beneficiaries. “With this system, we will supply the consumers with water for only P20 per cubic meter for the first five cubic meters at bottled water quality directly to their tap. We will also set up a team that will give our consumers the service they deserve,” said Rene M. Oliva Jr., vice president for public relatio...

item.title: Unplug at these remote resorts in the Philippines - CNN
item.description:
Unplug at these remote resorts in the Philippines  CNN

UNPLUG AT THESE REMOTE RESORTS IN THE PHILIPPINES: Want carefree island vibes and a stretch of sand all to yourself? Dedon Island in Surigao del Norte is the right place. Dedon Island Resort Dedon Island, Surigao del Norte: This upscale address is also a favorite among well-to-do surfing enthusiasts, thanks to its proximity to Cloud 9 -- a break in the Philippine Deep trench known for picture-perfect tubes. Dedon Island Resort Amanpulo, Pamalican Island: Claiming a plot of sand on its own private island, the exclusive address sprawls across 89-hectare Pamalican Island in the Sulu Sea -- abo...

item.title: Slain lawyer championed active non-violence: judge - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Slain lawyer championed active non-violence: judge  Sun.Star Philippines

JUDGE Raul Barbarona of the 14th Municipal Circuit Trial Court Dauis-Panglao shared a light moment with lawyers, including Mia Manuelita Mascariñas-Green, after hearing their cases last Monday. They talked about the disadvantages of old age. Most of them were well past their 40s. Two days later, two gunmen riding on a motorcycle killed Green, an environmental activist, while she was driving a car with her three young children onboard in Tagbilaran City, Bohol. The children were unharmed. A mass was offered for the lawyer at the corner of H. Zamora and J.A. Clarin Sts., where she was killed....

item.title: Garbage in paradise: The price of Panglao’s rise as tourist destination - Rappler
item.description:
Garbage in paradise: The price of Panglao’s rise as tourist destination  Rappler

(Part 2 of a series) Part 1: Panglao: Riding the tourism cash cow BOHOL, Philippines – Early on a Saturday, Jam Ungab leads a pack of volunteers from Plastic Free Bohol to pick up renegade trash along Libaong White Beach, a 3-kilometer stretch of white sand on the island of Panglao, Bohol. Locals say this stretch could rival Boracay – it depends really on who you ask. For they say the same of the other beaches on the island: a tricycle driver would point to Dumaluan Beach, a local favorite that's connected to Libaong Beach; a local official would claim the best are the undeveloped stretches...

item.title: Trouble in Panglao: Erring establishments, politics add to garbage woes - Rappler
item.description:
Trouble in Panglao: Erring establishments, politics add to garbage woes  Rappler

Conclusion Part 1: Panglao: Riding the tourism cash cow Part 2: Garbage in paradise: The price of Panglao's rise as tourist destination Part 3: New system for old problems: Panglao's struggle with solid waste Part 4: In Panglao: Tourism funds waste management and conservation PANGLAO, Bohol – Once Nenita* opens her sari-sari store along Panglao Circumferential Road, she makes sure that buyers throw their trash in the proper bins. She followed the rules: 4 bins properly labeled with biodegradable, non-biodegradable, residuals, and special wastes. She took it even further by indicating the t...

item.title: Panglao: Riding the tourism cash cow - Rappler
item.description:
Panglao: Riding the tourism cash cow  Rappler

PANGLAO, Bohol – In the late '90s, then 10-year-old Mark would troop to Panglao Island with his friends to catch damang, an indigenous fighting spider that proliferated in the once dense forests of the island. But by the time Mark reached his 20s and once the resorts started mushrooming, the damang disappeared. This, however, gave way to a consistent source of income for Mark: driving tourists to Panglao onboard his tricycle. Now 32, Mark has been frequenting Panglao to drive tourists who seek the island’s teal waters and sprawling beachfronts. He’s been at it for the last 15 years. “I go b...

item.title: In Panglao: Tourism funds waste management and conservation - Rappler
item.description:
In Panglao: Tourism funds waste management and conservation  Rappler

Part 4 of a series Part 1: Panglao: Riding the tourism cash cow Part 2: Garbage in paradise: The price of Panglao's rise as tourist destination Part 3: New system for old problems: Panglao's struggle with solid waste PANGLAO, Bohol – While tourism created a garbage problem for the municipality of Panglao, it’s also financing its new solid waste management system and environment conservation efforts on the ground. Ian, a cinematographer who frequently dives around the country, had been to the renowned 5 dive sites in Balicasag Island to interact and take snapshots of sea turtles, schools of...

item.title: New system for old problems: Panglao's struggle with solid waste - Rappler
item.description:
New system for old problems: Panglao's struggle with solid waste  Rappler

Part 3 of a series Part 1: Panglao: Riding the tourism cash cow Part 2: Garbage in paradise: The price of Panglao's rise as tourist destination PANGLAO, Bohol – With the tourism boom around the bend, the municipality of Panglao is banking on its 3-year-old system to solve the tourism-waste nexus. Celerina Mijos, a regular employee hired by the municipality, is a waste segregator, a key job in Panglao’s waste management system. Stationed at the Lourdes Ecological Facility, the central Mineral Recovery Facility (MRF) of Panglao, she clusters garbage collected by the barangay MRFs and prepar...

item.title: DOT chief to Boracay visitors: Be responsible tourists - CNN Philippines
item.description:
DOT chief to Boracay visitors: Be responsible tourists  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, October 26) — Tourism Secretary Berna Romulo Puyat had a simple reminder to tourists on the reopening of Boracay island. "As we welcome a better Boracay, the Department of Tourism urges everyone to be responsible tourists. It is the key to the preservation of this national treasure," she said in leading the formal reopening of the rehabilitated island on Friday. She called for discipline from the tourists. On the first day of Boracay's dry run opening on October 15, plastic bags, cups, and other trash were seen littered on the island's white sand beaches. Rela...

item.title: Cebu ‘An Established’ brand’ - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Cebu ‘An Established’ brand’  SunStar Philippines

CEBU will still get to enjoy high tourist arrivals amid Bohol’s opening of its own international airport. Tourism Secretary Bernadette Puyat believes that before jumping to other island destinations, tourists will still opt to land in Cebu and enjoy its unique tourism offerings. Puyat said Cebu is already an established brand in the global tourism market, citing the province’s good food, warm hospitality, pristine beaches and other natural wonders, as some of the factors that will sustain its steady arrivals. The tourism chief shared that in one of her visits to Japan and London, foreign gu...

item.title: ‘Cebu should step up tourism game’ - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
‘Cebu should step up tourism game’  SunStar Philippines

THE opening of the New Bohol Airport in Panglao, Bohol poses a challenge for Cebu to improve its tourism offerings to both local and foreign guests. When the country’s first “eco-airport” opens this month, it is expected to transform Bohol into a crowd-drawing destination. It will widely open its doors to more domestic and international flights. Tourists who want to go to Bohol may now opt to book direct flights to the island, bypassing Cebu. Stanley Go, president of Mandaue Chamber of Commerce and Industry (MCCI), said this is the price of progress Cebu has to face. “For the longest time, ...

item.title: New Bohol 'eco-airport' to be completed in October 2018, says DOTr - Rappler
item.description:
New Bohol 'eco-airport' to be completed in October 2018, says DOTr  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – The Department of Transportation (DOTr) said the New Bohol (Panglao) Airport in the island of Panglao is on track for its inauguration in October this year. The New Bohol Airport is set to become the country's first international eco-airport, with solar panels expected to power up 1/3 of the airport's Passenger Terminal Building. The airport, dubbed as the "Green Gateway to the World," will also use natural ventilation. (READ: 'World-class, eco-friendly' airport in Bohol to rise by 2018) "Everyone should be excited about Panglao airport. I am very excited. This is the ...

item.title: P2.1 billion set aside for upgrade of 6 VisMin airports - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
P2.1 billion set aside for upgrade of 6 VisMin airports  SunStar Philippines

A total of P2.1 billion has been set aside to modernize the infrastructure in six airports in the Visayas and Mindanao, Makati City Rep. Luis Campos Jr., an ex-officio member of the House appropriations committee, said over the weekend. The New Bohol (Panglao) International Airport is getting the biggest slice of the Aviation Infrastructure Program budget in the proposed P3.757-trillion General Appropriations Act for 2019, according to Campos. “The Panglao airport is getting an extra P754 million next year.” The new international airport is poised to start commercial operations in the weeks...

item.title: Wabe: Bohol’s best kept secret - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Wabe: Bohol’s best kept secret  SunStar Philippines

AS MOANA sang: See the line where the sky meets the sea, it calls me... I hate to admit when my husband is right. He wanted to take us to Anda, Bohol for the longest time, but I preferred the more popular destinations. My bad! Thankfully, my mother-in-law and sisters-in-law came to visit from New England, and they were hankering for a quiet time by the sea. Off the beaten path in a quaint town called, Anda, we had one of the best beach experiences as a family (and that’s saying a lot considering we have gone to many). This heaven on earth is without a doubt much better than the more “touris...

item.title: LOOK: The PH's First Eco-Airport Is Opening In August - FHM Philippines
item.description:
LOOK: The PH's First Eco-Airport Is Opening In August  FHM Philippines

The Philippines is no stranger to environmental initiatives—we have an eco-friendly wet market, an eco-friendly city hall, and now, it seems, an eco-friendly airport. The Department of Transportation announced that as of June 30, the New Bohol (Panglao) Airport is 90.14% complete. Poised to be the country's first "eco-airport", the airport is designed in order to be energy-efficient and sustainable, and is slated to open to commercial flights this August. IMAGE Department of Transportation Facebook Page IMAGE Department of Transportation Facebook Page IMAGE Department of Transportation Face...

item.title: New Bohol airport opening soon - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
New Bohol airport opening soon  SunStar Philippines

AFTER the completion of Terminal 2 in the Mactan-Cebu International Airport, Bohol is also set to have its own international airport. Engr. Edgardo Mangalili, project manager of the Department of Transportation (DOTr), said that starting in August, operations in the airport in Tagbilaran City will be transferred to the new Bohol-Panglao International Airport in the Panglao resort town. “In Tagbilaran, we have one international flight and 22 domestics, and whatever operation we have there will be transferred to the new airport,” he said. Compared to the old airport, the new airport is bigger...

item.title: Which tourist spots will be rehabilitated after Boracay? - Rappler
item.description:
Which tourist spots will be rehabilitated after Boracay?  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – In President Rodrigo Duterte's second year, the government ramped up efforts to conserve Philippine tourist hotspots. It all started when the interior, tourism, and environment departments suggested that Boracay be closed due to its grave environmental problems. In February, Duterte ordered the closure of the world-famous Boracay, which he called a "cesspool." Starting April 26, the island was closed to tourists for 6 months. The government has said that it doesn't want another case of Boracay to happen. In the past months, the Department of Environment and Natural Res...

item.title: Where to find remote and luxurious resorts in the Philippines - CNN
item.description:
Where to find remote and luxurious resorts in the Philippines  CNN

UNPLUG AT THESE REMOTE RESORTS IN THE PHILIPPINES: Want carefree island vibes and a stretch of sand all to yourself? Dedon Island in Surigao del Norte is the right place. Dedon Island Resort Dedon Island, Surigao del Norte: This upscale address is also a favorite among well-to-do surfing enthusiasts, thanks to its proximity to Cloud 9 -- a break in the Philippine Deep trench known for picture-perfect tubes. Dedon Island Resort Amanpulo, Pamalican Island: Claiming a plot of sand on its own private island, the exclusive address sprawls across 89-hectare Pamalican Island in the Sulu Sea -- abo...

item.title: CLI bares residential, hospitality projects - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
CLI bares residential, hospitality projects  Sun.Star Philippines

LISTED developer Cebu Landmasters Inc. (CLI) is bringing its residential and hospitality developments to Bohol.A 500-unit residential subdivision will mark CLI’s first foray in Bohol to be erected in Panglao Island this year.After which, the Cebuano-developer will erect a resort and residential project in a recently acquired five-hectare property, still on Bohol’s prime tourism island.CLI chairman and chief executive officer Jose Soberano III said they expect to spend around P1 billion for the construction of the subdivision.He, however, declined to disclose specific details for the second ...

item.title: House panel renames Panglao Island to Dauis-Panglao - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
House panel renames Panglao Island to Dauis-Panglao  Sun.Star Philippines

THE House committee on local government chaired by Representative Pedro Acharon Jr. has approved House Bill 6241, which seeks to rename Panglao Island to Dauis-Panglao Island.Bohol first district Repr

item.title: HRRAC assisting Lapu-Lapu with law compliance - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
HRRAC assisting Lapu-Lapu with law compliance  Sun.Star Philippines

THE Hotel, Resort and Restaurant Association of Cebu (HRRAC) and the Lapu-Lapu City Government are working closely together to make sure tourism establishments in Mactan remain compliant to environmental laws and observe proper waste disposal.Admitting that the temporary closure of Boracay Island for six months, starting today, served as a wake-up call, HRRAC president Carlo Suarez said programs had been implemented in Lapu-Lapu City in close coordination with its local government.He said they are working together to make sure tourism establishments, especially those located on the beach, h...

item.title: Editorial: Restoring the “cesspool” - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Editorial: Restoring the “cesspool”  Sun.Star Philippines

From world-class to test-case. As the six-month closure of Boracay approaches with the enforcement of the government order on April 26, the world watches to see how the government handles the process to allow the natural resources of the “resort island” to recover without economically displacing a community dependent on tourism revenues to the point of no return. Boracay’s rehabilitation is of particular interest to Cebu and Bohol. It is not only because these “alternatives” will absorb the tourists rerouted from Boracay during the closure. In a recent study, the Environmental Management Bu...

item.title: Baguio, other tourist sites also eyed for rehabilitation - Rappler
item.description:
Baguio, other tourist sites also eyed for rehabilitation  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – The Department of Tourism said that aside from beaches like Boracay, they are also looking at the possibility of rehabilitating other tourism sites in the Philippines, including Baguio. Tourism Secretary Wanda Teo said during a press conference on Saturday, April 14 that Environment Secretary Roy Cimatu has been going around the country to check on the status of the islands, especially the waste management systems of resorts. "Secretary Cimatu has been going around the Philippines now. He first went to Panglao, and then he went to Pagudpud and other places like El Nid...

item.title: DOT inspects Cebu tour spots - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
DOT inspects Cebu tour spots  Sun.Star Philippines

DEPARTMENT of Tourism (DOT) 7 Director Shalinar Hofer Tamano yesterday said the agency is closely working with the Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR) to correct violations of tourist spots that have caused pollution. Tamano said that DENR 7 Director Gilbert C. Gonzales told that they had issued notices of violations against erring owners of resorts and tourist destinations. The Environmental Management Bureau (EMB) is DENR’s implementing arm for the Clean Air Act, both in the private and government sectors. “Helping the DENR in preventing pollution in tourist destination...

item.title: Sun-kissed in Camiguin - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Sun-kissed in Camiguin  Sun.Star Philippines

CAMIGUIN is aptly nicknamed as the Island Born of Fire because anyone who comes here will surely leave a tad darker, bearing the mark of sun-kissed skin. Keep this little charming province in Mindanao on your radar because, aside from the popular White Island beach, it offers a lot of outdoor attractions. I’m not really a water baby, but the many times I’ve gone there, the island has not disappointed me one bit. This hot spot is definitely best enjoyed with family and friends! Keep in mind that there are no big five star resorts in the area like Discovery Shores, Astoria, Henann, or Shangri...

item.title: The Philippines' best beaches and islands - CNN
item.description:
The Philippines' best beaches and islands  CNN

Hollywood loves El Nido. Scenes for the final installment of the "Bourne" series were shot here. The island was also the setting of a pit stop on "The Amazing Race." istockphoto Off the coast of Samal lies Buena Vista Island, with its blindingly white beaches. Pretty lady sunbathing not guaranteed. Courtesy RNG Beyond this pier is Cloud 9, one of Siargao's most famous surf breaks. istockphoto Just your average Panglao beach. Tired of looking at white sands yet? We're not even halfway through. istockphoto Krabi who? The Philippines might not bring in the tourist numbers of Thailand, but its ...

item.title: Nonki targets beach goers of Panglao - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Nonki targets beach goers of Panglao  Sun.Star Philippines

NOW that she has several branches of Nonki Japanese Restaurant in Cebu, Davao and Iloilo, Cebu-based entrepreneur Ligaya Machida is going back to her roots. Machida, who owns eight branches of Nonki (which means carefree), is planning to open a branch in her home province of Bohol. This is to bring job opportunities to Boholanos and make quality Japanese food accessible to the province that is now enjoying a healthy boom in local and foreign tourist arrivals. “The Nonki branch in Bohol will be in Panglao. We have already secured a property there,” said Machida, who single-handedly manages t...

item.title: AirAsia to promote other PH destinations - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
AirAsia to promote other PH destinations  Sun.Star Philippines

FOLLOWING the closure of Boracay for six months starting April 26, the AirAsia Philippines will strengthen its promotions to other destinations in the country including tourist spots in Mindanao. AirAsia Philippines president and CEO Dexter Comendador told reporters on Thursday at the sidelines of the airline’s new Davao chocolate-flavored in-flight meal launching at the Malagos Garden and Resort that the closure, as expected, will affect their operations in Caticlan and Kalibo including the Davao–Caticlan/Kalibo direct flight, which was launched summer of last year. “A significant portion ...

item.title: Spreading ‘humor’ is economic sabotage – Bohol mayor's memo - Rappler
item.description:
Spreading ‘humor’ is economic sabotage – Bohol mayor's memo  Rappler

These days, it looks like being sloppy in government issuances and memos is in. Recently a Malacañang Press Corps ID riddled with grammatical errors was released by the Presidential Communications Office and became the subject of online derision. Before that, the Philippine News Agency under Communications Secretary Martin Andanar used a logo of Dole Philippines, the company that produces processed pineapples, for a story on the Department of Labor and Employment, which uses Dole for its acronym. A Bohol mayor is among the latest to join the bandwagon. Marcos Guirit, assistant market admini...

item.title: Swedish national dies in electrocution accident in Bohol resort - Rappler
item.description:
Swedish national dies in electrocution accident in Bohol resort  Rappler

BOHOL, Philippines - Another foreign national vacationing in Panglao Island in Bohol province, one of the most popular tourist destinations in the country, died in a freak accident on Wednesday, March 21. According to reports reaching the Bohol Police Provincial Office (BPPO), Bengt Gustaf Ludvig Linne, 59, a Swedish national billeting at Hidden Dream Resort in Barangay Tawala, Panglao, accidentally stepped on a wet pathway of the resort that had been exposed to a power wire. Police said Linne was walking with his girlfriend, identified as Nemia Dagsaan Baylen, 37, of Botulan, Zambales. Inv...

item.title: 6 Mactan resorts violate easement rules - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
6 Mactan resorts violate easement rules  Sun.Star Philippines

MORE than 90 resorts in Central Visayas, including six situated in Mactan Island in Cebu, have violated a law that prevents the establishment of structure without easement along coastlines, said an official of the Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR) 7. In a press conference Tuesday, Nestor Canda of DENR 7’s Provincial Environment and Natural Resources Office (PENRO) said around 93 resorts in the region were found to have violated Presidential Decree 1067, known as the Water Code of the Philippines. Canda, who is PENRO’s Task Force Foreshore Area Management regional coordi...

item.title: JPark Panglao to begin construction in April - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
JPark Panglao to begin construction in April  Sun.Star Philippines

CEBU-BASED BXT Corp. announced it will start construction of JPark Island Resort Panglao next month. “We will have ceremonial groundbreaking on April 7,” said BXT Corp. president Justin Uy. Uy said they are investing at least P8 billion for the development of the resort, which sits on a 24-hectare property in Panglao Island, Bohol. The development, which will be done in three phases, will initially have 1,200 guest rooms and a convention facility that can accommodate at least 1,600 guests. “The Panglao project will have a bigger waterpark,” said Uy, also owner of Profood International Corp....

item.title: HRRAC: Cebu resorts comply with rules - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
HRRAC: Cebu resorts comply with rules  Sun.Star Philippines

MEMBER properties of the Hotel, Resort, and Restaurant Association of Cebu (HRRAC) said they are compliant with all the regulatory policies of government, including those concerning the environment. “We follow what is required. Even so, we do more initiatives to protect our environment,” said HRRAC president Carlo Suarez. President Rodrigo Duterte recently called out Boracay and Panglao for environmental violations and threatened to shut them down. The National Economic and Development Authority (Neda) said that local government officials and resort owners caught violating environmental, sa...
